website_summaries.verdict: An extra support system for the middle of your frame to help support your mattress or box spring.
pros: Sturdy and easy to put together
Can handle a lot of weight
Helps correct middle dipping on a mattress
cons: Frame has some plastic parts and is not 100% constructed of metal

website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, quality bed-slats replacement to give you a good night’s sleep.
cons: Unhelpful instructions and tricky to assemble
Plastic leg supports could break if not careful

customer_reviews.title: Great support! Totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and exactly what we needed. Before, we just had wooden slats and they always kept falling out. This support is perfect. Assembly was easy; ignore the reviews that say otherwise. If you can read a two page instruction sheet and use some common sense, you're good. My only "gripe" is that the steel supports are quite spread apart. I added some wood slats in between for added support (see picture). I'm sure it would have been fine, but I like having the extra stability.
customer_reviews.author: Cody McPherson

customer_reviews.title: I weigh in at 250lb--frame is great
customer_reviews.text: With two big bodies (both over 200lbs) that pseudo bed frame from Sweden didn't have a chance. We installed this support system about three weeks ago and that frame is doing its jobs--good enough for some midnight madness now
customer_reviews.author: shawn lyons

customer_reviews.title: Used on king size bed
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty proud of myself today after putting this together! Instructions were easy to follow and install took under an hour. Probably less if you’re familiar with building furniture. I ordered a sleep number mattress that will be coming in about a week or so and I needed extra support in the frame of my bed since the wood was sagging (quality Ashley furniture bed lol) however, this really solved the problem and offered the right amount of support. Would highly recommend if you’re looking to add support to the bed. Only issue I had was that it didn’t support the length of the bed from head to foot.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time and effort (not to mention the money)
customer_reviews.text: 1. Directions are difficult to read and follow. Diagrams showing how the pieces come together are useless. Too many flaws here to go into detail. 2. Braces that hold legs were damaged to the point where we had to hammer in the plastic joints that hold the legs into the beams. 3. X Cross beams that hold the three main pieces together would not fit without causing the main beams to come off the bed frame and put the support out of balance. Directions and diagrams were particularly useless here. 4. Not worth the time and effort. For the money spent, we could have hired a handy man to build a wood frame support for the bed.
customer_reviews.author: CJT

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this frame for my queen size sleigh bed and it fit perfectly. I agree with others: The instructions could be better however, I checked youtube for an instructional video and found one to follow. After that, it was up in no time, rock solid, study as hell and not going anywhere. I think it took me about 15 minutes total to get it fully assembled. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone needing a sturdy bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: maggies mom

customer_reviews.title: poor engineering, worse instructions
customer_reviews.text: Instruction sheet must have been written in a foreign land. No mention whatsoever of proper placement of the notched scissors couplings. It is trial and error until the installer gets it right. Furthermore, if the clearance between bed box spring support and floor is 10.75", the vertical screw supports are too long using the height adapter or they are too short without the adapter. Poor engineering. The screw needs to be at least an inch longer to "bite" into the nylon (?) anchor for proper support. My installation necessitated the use of support discs between carpet and support bearer. After this modification, the system worked.
customer_reviews.author: Technically Proficient

customer_reviews.title: Great replacements for the old wooden supports but inaccurate description with the sizes.
customer_reviews.text: This worked out perfectly for replacing my old wood support ones. I own a king size bed and this will support the weight needed. Like previous reviews, I agree with others concerns with the plastic pieces for the legs. I wish this company would include steel or aluminum nuts and washers. The description is inaccurate with the sizes as the x brace was too short to reach the supports. This will more likely work with a queen size and below. I ended up going to home Depot to buy three 3/8 hex nuts and 3/8 washers to work with the plastic pieces for the cross supports.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: READ THE REVIEWS! Quick fix!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you to the other reviewers! After almost two years, the plastic bits on the frame finally gave up the ghost. Thanks to the other reviewers, I ran over to Lowe’s today and picked up some washers and hex nuts and we are back in business! Other than this snag, this is a very sturdy bed frame- infinitely better than the sad wood slats our Rooms to Go king bed came with. If it weren’t for those shoddy plastic pieces, this would be a five star product all around.
customer_reviews.author: Erin K. Parke

customer_reviews.title: Good temporary solution
customer_reviews.text: This is a good solution if you bought a cheap bed that is giving you grief but you don't want to just throw it out. If this means I can avoid a $600 new bed purchase for another year or so, then I'm happy. I won't be surprised if those little plastic pieces break in 8 months- I know what I signed up for after reading other reviews. Giving 4 stars because the package arrived extremely damaged with holes in the box. Other than that, the product is as described and I didn't encounter any issues with assembly or parts.
customer_reviews.author: Elise C.

customer_reviews.title: Find another company
customer_reviews.text: There were no direction. There were no assembly aids. Black paint flecks galore. Web site next to useless for directions. Only thing that helped was a persons utube video. Would not recommend dealing with this company. They need to get their act together and become customer friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Dickenson

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with metal frame.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a metal frame it has worked well so far. Fortunately my frame had holes marking the center of the railing, so I could anchor the middle crossbeam by dropping fasteners into the holes and the others didn't wander, much. For best results, make crossbeams as tight as possible to the frames (consider using adhesive if you don't want to drill holes ), and adjust legs to just touch the floor; not too high to cause crossbeam wobble, not too low to allow foundation to sag. Make some minor adjustments with a blunt instrument after you drop on the mattress and foundation, and "nuttin' ain't goin' nowhere. " Definitely more fun than wrangling loose slats!
customer_reviews.author: Norm from GA

customer_reviews.title: Added much needed support
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a new box spring and mattress for a bed frame and within a couple months it was sagging in the middle. Normally I would resort to a piece of plywood under the mattress but when I looked under the bed I saw there was absolutely no support in the center of the mattress at all. I was looking at a new frame and then saw this. This was perfect. I also purchased some bed risers. This allowed me to give myself 13” of storage under my bed. A little difficult to put together for one person but directions were easy to follow. Immediate improvement. Don’t hesitate to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lorey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Please include instructions for all bed frames or change the ad on this site.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought an expensive hybrid mattress and box springs. Our bed did not have the center support system. That expensive mattress was miserably uncomfortable. Instead of buying a new bed frame, we bought the Glideaway. The ad says it fits all bed frames. We have an iron bed. I was upset when we got emailed instructions for a wooden bed frame and the package instructions were for wooden bed frames. Luckily, my husband was able to install it. The expensive hybrid mattress set is now comfortable. When you buy one of those expensive bedsets, especially from Simmons, make sure you look at the warrenty before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy a 3/8 nut and washer for each center support
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent support frame, but you have to buy a 3/8 nut and washer for each center support (the adjustable screw and plastic part that contacts the floor will break otherwise, per many reviews). It is very strange to me that the seller has not remedied this problem since there are a lot of reviews that mention this issue. The manufacturer/seller could fix this problem with $1.50 of metal nuts and washers and its very strange to me that they haven't.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: A trip to the hardware store is required....
customer_reviews.text: If the hieght of your bed from floor to box spring bottom exceeds 10” you are going to need to attach included extenders to the legs. The extenders are attached to the legs by nut, washer and bolt. These required nuts and bolts for the extenders are not included in the kit, so a trip to the hardware store is required. I bought and placed six sets in the extenders, though you could do it with three . Once together it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Bed is rock solid using this on wooden frame sleigh bed.
customer_reviews.text: Need to pay attention to where notch is assembling the center scissor supports. Love that you could use this on different sized beds. It has made my sleigh bed very sturdy. Love that you can raise or lower feet on each of the three cross supports. Secured the support arms to bed frame rails and the bed is rock solid. Easier solution than buying strapping or other wood to support the box spring, cutting it and assembling. Well made and thought out product. Buddy who helped me move mattress and box spring was also impressed with this product. Figure about 15 min to assemble out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Labrax

customer_reviews.title: Bed support frame for box type bed frame
customer_reviews.text: This frame has made my bed feel like brand new. Previously it was sagging in a few areas of which we figured out was from the 3 slats and posts underneath providing no support for the heavy high end mattress. Not the proper support. Put together which was not too hard with the directions. Maybe needed a screwdriver and a hammer and that was it. Back pain I was having was resolved after one night sleeping on the mattress with this new frame. Also slept better than I have in two years.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy 12345

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what I did wrong but I could not get all three bars to stay even once I added the crossbars. I'm usually pretty handy at installation but this one just didn't work for me. It's put together as best I could. 1 hole seems to be off on the crossbar so it won't screw in properly. Too much hassle to return so I left it as is with crossbars attached with 1 not screwed in. Has a slight movement but not worth the hassle to try to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You DO need this!
customer_reviews.text: We got a new mattress, thinking it was the problem. Then noticed that it sagged in the middle, just like the old one. So we stacked some books under the bed right down the middle to support it. This was obviously a temporary fix and we still were not sold on the comfort of our new mattress. Then we got this dealy. Wow! What a difference! The bed is somehow way more comfy and supportive and we can't believe the difference. Maybe we should've just kept the old mattress and just given it some new support. Oh well, the point is, this is an awesome thing and it was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Really Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is really sturdy and I mean really. A little difficult to attach the two X to keep the center support just where they need to be and believe me the written instructions were not good (and I am really good at following instructions). All that said, the quality of the support frame cannot be questioned.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C.

customer_reviews.title: Solved the problem
customer_reviews.text: Had a frame that had only one center rail, insufficient to support box springs at top and bottom. This kit fit in nicely, all hardware included, 10 minute install and voila, no more sagging box springs. Used on metal frame, not wood rails, but seems it would work for wood frame just as well. Good design and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: fussybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last a year
customer_reviews.text: Have had this under the bed for less than a year now. Today I sat down and heard a pop... all 3 of the plastic pieces have broken... its just me, There wasn't any rough housing or anything else going on o blame, just me sitting down. Im guessing the others plasitc pieces had broke sometime before and today was the last one... i will now have to buy another support system... this should have lasted longer than a year it didnt even last that long... Very disappointed. Would appreciate a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kourtney

customer_reviews.title: Finally the support we've needed
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced our mattress set and deliveryman questioned lack of center support on our existing wooden frame. Told him I've got this, and ordered this Glideaway X-Support system for the bed. Very easy to install, and after reading several other reviews, decided to add the fender washers and lock nuts to the center support feet as a precaution to prevent possibility of the original plastic nut failing. Loved the easy of installation, and now have a rock solid support frame under our bed. Very pleased with this system...
customer_reviews.author: Alan L

customer_reviews.title: What a nice surprise!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was a little worried that this would not work since I've seen other products at much higher prices. It was so EASY to assemble contrary to what some people posted. I feel a definite difference on the sturdiness of my bed. I replaced an old wood frame that was beginning to sag with this metal frame. I'm so happy I did! It is a night and day difference for me and slept like I haven't slept in a long time! I couldn't be happier with this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: James I. Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: Get the extra washers and nuts that you need before assembling.
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I needed for my bed. Had wooden slats from ikea but I could never find the middle bar for support. These fit perfectly inside of my current frame. I only gave 3 stars for sturdiness because of the plastic part everyone else is talking about. It's an easy fix, about $5. Makes you wonder why they made everything else so well and missed the mark COMPLETELY with one of the most integral parts of the frame. I would have easily paid $5 more for such a sturdy frame had they just took that cost upfront.
customer_reviews.author: CharZards9

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Instructions included aren't the best.
customer_reviews.text: Installed today. Instructions unclear on the X pieces when using foot extensions, but the picture on Amazon was a good enough clarification. Extremely sturdy compared to the tiny spindles that came with our king size frame. Will wait and see if the white plastic pieces for screwing in the feet hold up, but at least there are reviews with repair instructions if the break. I'd buy it again if I screw up and buy an unstable bed frame again.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Bush

customer_reviews.title: works good, setup sucks
customer_reviews.text: PROS: super sturdy CONS: A pain to set up. The screws it comes to use to attach to side rail of bed did not work from us. Thank god dad did't raise no quitter.. after hours of making my own screws its secure. The center support, even Einstein wouldn't be able to figure if out. It's confusing, doesn't bend or snap like it should. OVERALL: it holds my kids bed up with more support and that's what I was looking for 5/5 of sturdiness 5/5 being a pain in my ass assembling.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Melcher

customer_reviews.title: the product was fine
customer_reviews.text: The product was fine, but I had to use aftermarket fasteners, because the ones that it came with, were not long enough for my kids bed. Other than that inconvenience (which is why I scored it low on assembly and installation) this is a fine product. Just wanted folks who may purchase this in the future, to be aware a trip to lowes might be needed to finish up. The frame has been in use for several months now, and is solid!
customer_reviews.author: Trav

customer_reviews.title: All beds should come with this
customer_reviews.text: The GS-3 is super supportive and sturdy. It actually upsets me that my $1000 bed came with cheap wooden supports that broke after three years. The individual rails are, in themselves, very strong but the X braces tie them all together and really solidify the system. I drilled some holes in the metal bars to attach a sheet of plywood to because I don't like to use a box to support my mattress. Really good design, would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: MustangsbyMatt

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the supplied wood screws
customer_reviews.text: The structure itself is great. The instructions are awful. They can as a one page folded up in the hardware bag and were almost completely destroyed, torn apart by the hardware. The screws included that attach to the bed frame are the weakest screws I have ever used. 3 of the 6 completely stripped out even using low torque and a perfect fitting screw driver. Please if you but this get 6 wood screws and don't attempt to use the ones they supply.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Works great for California King Mattress in METAL frame!
customer_reviews.text: The Glideaway X Support is a top quality product that was easy to assemble because of clear instructions and illustrations. It was purchased to add foundation support for a California King mattress on a metal bedframe and it works perfectly! Additional hex screws, washer locks and nuts were purchased because of the metal frame at a cost of $2.50. It took longer to drill new holes in the frame than to assemble the support. This is a fantastic product and I would highly recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Goke

customer_reviews.title: Worst instructions ever!
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine... after you assemble it. Maybe you are smarter than me but the instructions are a joke. What should be very, very easy to assemble is not. Notches must match bottom of L brackets to allow room for cross bar. Found a youTube video that easily explained set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor

customer_reviews.title: Nice bed support
customer_reviews.text: I had a king be I refinished and no supports. Got this and it arrived quickly and in the original box. The instructions were a little lacking and I had to do some trial and error on the center cross-supports. They only get installed one way. Also the height adjustment is a little confusing. But, all the parts were there and it seems like a quality setup and is very adjustable to different bed sizes and heights.
customer_reviews.author: GA. Post

customer_reviews.title: Broken plastic pieces on legs after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in 11/2017 and it just broke! The plastic pieces on the legs broke. Not happy, I’m getting a hip replacement and don’t need to have bed collapse! First two pictures are broken, last picture in not broken.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, huge upgrade in an instant
customer_reviews.text: Every bed kit should come with this standard. $2,500 mattress with slats and foundation, slats were sagging, bed was creaky. Installed this king size frame in about an hour. Foundation is solid. No more creaking. Full support for the mattress. Mattress feels Brand New again. Makes me wish I had this from the get go to be able to enjoy the full quality of our king size tempur-pedic. Felt the difference from the moment I laid down on it after install.
customer_reviews.author: roland scott garza

customer_reviews.title: Useful and well made
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and as advertised. It did not quite meet our needs for the bed we purchased it for, but with a little modification did the trick. No fault of the manufacturer, but the bed frame we were repairing was not made for this type of support. Unfortunately, the bed has been discontinued, so no direct replacement was available, but this item proved useful as replacing the entire bed was not desirable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Not an A+ but def like it
customer_reviews.text: This was harder to do than anticipated ...there are parts I couldn't figure out how to install.i had no helper. I think that have been better. It doesn't stay in place as good as is like but it mite be because I had hard time putting together. I am heavyset person so I picked this one for stuffiness and ease. It's worth the money for sure...i just dunno if the missing parts I couldn't figure out how to install cause it to be unsteady or not lol fit it inside my wooden frame and added a bunkyboard too
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: Great product but read reviews for pointers before you start
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to the many other reviews with extremely helpful tips. Read the reviews in detail before you start. Ignore the negative reviews as this is a good sturdy product. It does have the one weak part ( as others pointed out) that I fixed before assembly. Went to Lowe’s and purchased a nut and washer to reinforce the nylon piece that otherwise fails in time. This was a metal bed and I had no problem making it work. I had 2 existing rails I added to give it extra support. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: JGW Texas

customer_reviews.title: Not workable for all antique beds!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this does not work on many antique beds, especially if there is not a continuous solid wood rail to screw the preset cross-members to. We had evenly spaced 4 inch gaps which were made to accept the bed slats and some of the cross supports of this frame fell in those spots, making it unuseable, unless perhaps we would have cut wood pieces to fill in those gaps. We were not looking for a partial solution so had to return it. This also cost us our time and the return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: eric huenneke

customer_reviews.title: Best Sleep Ive Had
customer_reviews.text: I downsized from a king to a queen. The new bed didn't have stable support and the legs were sinking in, which caused major back pain. These new bed frame supports are the best purchase I've made to date through amazon, get you a set whether your bed frame has similar issues or not. Will require two people, instructions are easy to follow and understandable with common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Christella Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy  Bed Support
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy support but assembly is not simple. Must measure carefully so the center support is EXACTLY in the center of the bed frame and the two side supports are the same distance apart from the center support. One would assume the cross tie connectors (make sure notch end is up on both at the center support) would keep the end supports the same distance but not necessarily. The screw down ends tend to pull inward and must be pulled out to the same distance when screwing down. Of course the three plastic supports must be modified with nuts and washers as mentioned in other reviews. Once installed correctly it should support a small elephant.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL SAUNDERS

customer_reviews.title: Great Product....at first
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bed frame when I first got it. It wasn't hard for my husband to install it. Almost a year later, the plastic piece has in the center has snapped completely. The plastic piece in the top middle has been stripped because it is slowly sagging down. The durability of this product is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Antunez

customer_reviews.title: I have read other reviews that say the directions are great. However
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Glideaway for a few weeks and so far the bed is still rock steady. I have read other reviews that say the directions are great. However, in my opinion they are hard to see details in the drawing. There are notcheson the X supportsthat yiu have to place accurately on the stands to give maximium support and the drawing do no not show you this detail. I had to attach the additional leg supports and since the holes predrilled by the manufacturer didn't align or had no holes wether they needed to be I had to drill pilot holes to attach the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Dever

customer_reviews.title: Plastic frame supports will not last
customer_reviews.text: Wow, after 2 years all three of the plastic legs are broken. Why in the world would you use a cheap plastic part where all of the weight of the frame, box spring and mattress are concentrated. Unfortunately, I did not see the reviews written since I bought this frame. Now I have to buy something completely new along with the labor to fix this. Too late to try what the one reviewer suggested with the metal 3/8" nuts to fix the situation.
customer_reviews.author: timmer

customer_reviews.title: Replace the white plastic bits
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the support thanks to the "X" design. The problem comes when the plastic bolts, as seen above and which have been complained about before, break and fall apart easily. Currently my daughter's bed is on a decline slant from the footboard (last picture which is where the plastic white piece is supposed to be) to the headboard ( first picture where the plastic piece is now 😒). Please take the time to either A) add additional white plastic pieces in the packaging and/or include nuts to hold that plastic piece better than now, or 2) get rid of those plastic pieces altogether! Other than that, it is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: strong center support for existing bed frame
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together. Strong center added to my existing king/queen bed frame with already 2 support metal bars ... overkill? but rock solid and very happy. follow great advise from previous purchaser and pick up 3-3/8” wing nuts, 3 washers and 3 regular 3/8” nuts - work like a charm (also added the same wing nuts to my existing support bar)
customer_reviews.author: JoT

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about the crossbars
customer_reviews.text: This went together quite easily. Lets see three bars across the frame and it was done. Just make sure you can secure it properly to the frame and never worry again. On my queen frame the crossbars down the center don't work as I didn't want to create more holes in the frame. If I were to create additional holes they may have fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tia Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought a vintage bed frame set with head and foot boards, but it wouldn't support our split box frame. I found this item on amazon and it shipped quick. The frame came with attachments to adjust to the height of the frame which was very helpful. Mounting the glideaway to my frame required a power drill. Didn't take more than 30 minutes to fully assemble and install. Wife is happy, so I can be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Kilcline

customer_reviews.title: this frame worked out great for my king size bed
customer_reviews.text: this frame worked out great for my king size bed. the package on arrival was very heavy as the frames are made of metal. the instructions were decent but really if you look at the item and assemble the first few pieces the rest are easy to assemble as they follow the same pattern. overall very happy with this sturdy product and definitely worth the money i paid for it in comparison to the frames at the furniture stores asking $100 plus for a king size frame.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy K.

customer_reviews.title: Strong but difficult to install!
customer_reviews.text: It is a good and Sturdy product but we bought it for the ease of installation over wooden frame where it failed. It took us almost 2 hours to put it together. Instructions were not clear and a pack of screws was missing where we had to recycle some of our own screws. It is good and strong once put together but taking 2 stars away because of missing pieces and installation.
customer_reviews.author: Alka

customer_reviews.title: Great Bed Frame
customer_reviews.text: This bed frame was fairly easy to install....instructions were easy to understand...and it worked for my bed perfectly. I did go on YouTube and watched a person assemble it so I would feel more comfortable assembling it myself...that really helped. I am a 68 year old female, and it took me about 30 minutes to install.
customer_reviews.author: Livypup

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace the standard wooden boards that kept breaking or bowing. My mattress and box spring no longer sag. It’s been very sturdy with 2 heavier adults on it regularly. We did follow others tips and Picked up washers and used those during the installation. It’s been several months and no problems as of yet. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old wooden slats with this one and mattress feels totally different now. Really added good and sturdy support. 2 complaints: Assembly directions for x support system is not really clear, did some trial and error to install those properly. Wood nails provided are also not of good quality. Both of these things needed remediation for other buyers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works with metal rails, just buy more bolts and nuts.
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect. I have an antique bed frame and the rails are metal. This added some much needed support exactly where I needed it. I love the adjustable rails and feet. I took the advice from other reviewers and bought nuts and washers for extra support for the plastic feet. I took it one step further and drilled holes and bolted it to the existing frame. I wrote down exactly what was on the directions and bought 6 more bolts and hex nuts from the hardware store. As a bonus for anyone who cares, Tempurpedic sells an ultra low profile box spring that is 2" thick. No more leaping into bed.
customer_reviews.author: amy pecora

customer_reviews.title: Two to assemble one to make dysfunctional
customer_reviews.text: Product is dysfunctional after less than a month of use. Unfortunately outside of the return policy
customer_reviews.author: Ruhamah Grooms

customer_reviews.title: Felt the difference first night
customer_reviews.text: It took us a little while to figure out which way the supports went, but once we realized the notch went on top and the middle shared holes it was all good. Also took advice of some other posters and got metal nut and washer to secure the plastic nut. It’s only been one night but fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Willeke

customer_reviews.title: Stars aren't the whole story.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble however the instructions suck they are not helpful at all, no detail whatsoever. My bed has predrilled holes so the X fram doesn't fit and I'm not gonna void my warranty or crack or split the beds supports trying move the frame closer together. And I never considered that my box spring would now slide around on the metal Support I'm now looking for another product ($$$) to prevent this Constant shifting or sliding of the box spring and mattress and it a king so its a lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: Dontaye

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Movers broke the wooden feet of the slats that came with our bed. I tried ordering a kit that had like 20 wooden slats. It did not work. This product is awesome it fit perfectly on our king size that we bought from Gerome’s in SD. it took about 30 mins to install including moving the box springs and mattress. Easy follow directions and best of all it is sturdy! No more sagging in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Better option to the wooden legs that come with your King
customer_reviews.text: I always get frustrated that king size beds have very flimsy support in the center. No matter the price of the bed, it is typically held up with 3 wooden legs that move, bend, and do not last. These are the perfect replacements making the bed feel more durable and stable. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Brito

customer_reviews.title: No good for metal frames...
customer_reviews.text: If you have a wooden rail bedframe, this product will probably be ok. But this is not meant for metal bedframes. So unless you include the tools to make that possible, do not advertise as much. The instructions seem rushed. Reading the instructions and figuring out what and why they named their parts the way they did was a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: I Am the One who Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great for home made bed!
customer_reviews.text: Just completed a rustic king bed using plans from the internet. Needed a center support bracket that would be more robust than the thin strips of wood that the plans called for. I ordered this and installed it as the final piece to our bed. Instructions are easy to follow and the item is well built with sturdy steel. The bed is very sturdy with this attached as the center support. I expect it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Prevents mattress sagging; works with any traditional bedframe
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price! We switched from a metal bedframe on casters to a traditional wooden bedframe with attached headboard/footboard. Our old bedframe had a center support bar & foot, which works to prevent the mattress from sagging in the middle. Our new bedframe did not have any center support. Our mattress was sagging within weeks, until I found this product. It's easy to install and the center support is fully adjustable, accommodating a wide range of bedframe heights. I can't say enough about it - very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: cd

customer_reviews.title: By far the best Bed Frame Support out there
customer_reviews.text: For 6 years I have been using a sub-standard bed frame support that came with my expensive king-size bed. It finally fell apart in the middle of the night. I was skeptical when I bought the Glideway support system but now I am very pleased. It is a simple design that will support your box frame and mattress for a lifetime. My only ad vice is to follow the instructions closely.
customer_reviews.author: Maximillian Burton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a pain in the ass to install do u hear me??? No seriously it needs better instructions it was very irritating to assemble but once put together it works so good!! It’s very sturdy it’s worth the money and it saves my bedroom set who needs wooden boards or wooden mattress supports when this exists I’m glad I bought this I just wish it wasn’t so hard to put together
customer_reviews.author: clelacece

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for my bed and it is incredibly sturdy. It was, for the most part, easy to assemble. A part of the instruction wasn’t clear, but I was able to maneuver around it ( I did miss a part/step at the end, but ended up to still hold without it). Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: A great fix for wooden bed slats
customer_reviews.text: Our bed frame had wooden slats that would consistently twist sideways and we would have to go under the bed to straiten them. Also, on one of the wood slats, the plastic foot broke, leaving the screw exposed which then scratched our floor significantly before we noticed. This has been the perfect solution. There were a couple of gaps in the instructions but by looking at the pictures and following the logic of the process, we managed. It could be done with one person but it was certainly much easier having 2 people. I can tell this will be sturdy and will last for a very long time and has given us great peace of mind the past few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Chatham

customer_reviews.title: Super strong, horrible instructions
customer_reviews.text: Once assembled, this worked perfectly with a King Size Restoration Hardware canopy bed. Instructions are confusing and the pictures aren't helpful for a very key step. Videos on YouTube aren't much better, but the product is totally solid and our bed no longer sags in the middle - feels and looks very supported and strong. Tip: notches go at the top and support the next X bar. Took about an hour and 4 videos to stumble through figuring that out. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: hockeyfan23

customer_reviews.title: Def needs more metal slats for support in middle of the bed.
customer_reviews.text: We have a queen size bed. The bed frame was not very supportive in the middle & the mattress sunk a little in the middle even on a box spring, we needed to add more support in the middle. We added 4 1x2 wood slats you the middle. Once we did that, it’s been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: DIY’er Fam

customer_reviews.title: Would probably work well and assemble well, if the package came direct and unopened.
customer_reviews.text: Package came on delivery date as scheduled. Needed this item to complete bedroom for arriving guests. Box was obviously previously opened. No assembly instructions in the box and had to download off the web. The screws in the box were not long enough to assemble as instructed, don't know if they were switched or correct ones were in the box to begin with. Had to purchase longer bolts to complete the assembly as I could not wait to do an item return or exchange. Otherwise item works well for it's intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Dowe

customer_reviews.title: Ugh. Should trust reviews better.
customer_reviews.text: As everyone else says, the plastic bits will break on you. Assembled ours the beginning on August 2019 and by November 2019 2 plastic parts have broken. I could use the reinforcing idea others have come up with,but I unfortunately encountered more damage. Because the plastic bits essentially hold the height, if they break your bed sags. Well ours sagged enough it pulled the wood side rails of our bed and snapped them right off the headboard and footboard. So now my wooden bed is broken, and my metal frame is needing additional hardware to be useable.
customer_reviews.author: ashleye

customer_reviews.title: This has awesome support!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical with buying this bed frame. However, I made a huge leap of faith and I am ecstatic that I did. This bed frame is durable and has given so much support the bed. The mattress has a huge "crater" or "dip" in the middle where my son sleeps. Also, the box spring squeaked and creaked which kept me up ALL NIGHT LONG. I felt so bad because I know that he sleep was non-existent because he was so uncomfortable. So, after we install the frame, the creaking stop immediately. The dip in the mattress was lifted and his sleep is so much better for this frame. This was a great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Kia W.

customer_reviews.title: The frame was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The frame was easy to assemble, though one of the bolts was missing. The edge of the packaging had been torn in transit and since some of the bolts were loose in the box, it probably came out in transit. Fortunately, I had one at home that fit. I needed a frame to attach to my wooden bed frame and this one did. I have been using the frame for a couple of weeks and it works as expected. If I needed another frame, I would purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommend
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I went ahead and made this purchase. I made the bad decision of getting a bed frame with (unbeknownst to me) cheap slates. My wooden slates legs would all fall and the slates looked and felt weak to the point where I felt my bed will eventually collapse. I prolonged getting something sturdier for months thinking I would probably need a new bed frame but this saved me from going that far. I was skeptical of only having three of the metal slates but it was stronger and sturdier than all 6 slates I had before. I kept the original slates and put these as reinforcements and now I’m confident my bed will hold. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Harrigan

customer_reviews.title: Very Good, BUT ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to support a king bed with wooden head/foot boards and wooden side rails. Liked stability and strength of using wood screws where steel rails lapped bed's wooden side rails, and liked the strength of center cross bracing at center of steel rails. The overall strength of the completed unit seems mitigated by those 3 (breakable) plastic receptacles for the 3/8 threaded adjustable height feet. The plastic needs to be designed out of this otherwise reasonably priced strenthening devise!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Swisher

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bed Support
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this for a couple of weeks now, and everything seems to be working great. We had purchased a nice 4-poster frame and had been waiting to assemble it in our house until we were sure to have the proper support for our bed. The pieces felt heavy and sturdy out of the box, and while it did take a little bit to assemble it wasn't too difficult (just took a bit of time and we had to drill some new holes in the existing bed-frame to line up with the support rails). So far we have been quite happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S Crawley

customer_reviews.title: Great support - way better than the wood supports
customer_reviews.text: We recently switched bedframes but kept the same boxframe and mattress. The old bed had a wooden framework and wood supports. The new bed also has a wooden framework and it came with wood supports. I was searching for something to provide stronger support. the Glideaway X-Support Bed Frame Support System provides exactly what we needed. The system fit perfectly into the king size frame. My wife and I both have commented after 2 weeks how much better this mattress feels in the new bed ve the old and I attribute it all to the X-Support system.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R Oster

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: The product is sturdy and provides ample support. Gave a new lease of life to my king sized bed. Its a bit cumbersome to assemble and install ~ 30 minutes to figure out how to line things up. Install was another 15 minutes. The packaging was damaged with I received it. The product itself was undamaged so I did not return it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabarish Muthumperumal

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Was so glad to find this as our bed slats got lost in a move and Ashley's Furnititre wouldn't just sell them individually. I tried making slats and buying some from walmart but ended up returning it because they kept falling. I was hesitant on buying this but I am glad I did. It took about a hour to assemble it. I figured it out by watching YouTube videos and i did it by myself After doing it once I would say it would take me about 15 minutes if I had to redo it now. We have a king bed and have been using it for over a year now.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I’ve made this month
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we needed to replace the flimsy wooden supports our bed frame had originally. The instructions were confusing to say the least, but we figured it out with some troubleshooting and luck. I usually hesitate to praise anything until we’ve had it awhile (in case something happens a week later), but I have no doubt this is sturdy and reliable for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Great Price & Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a reasonably priced bed frame to replace the cheap one that came with the bed I purchased at the local furniture store several years ago. I recently changed my mattress and the company (Saatva) had a great bedframe but it would not retrofit to my wood frame bed. The bedframe that I purchased with the X-Bar solved this problem. Assembly was very easy. It did take me a bit longer as I did not have my power drill charged but nonetheless it went together flawlessly & has adapted very well to my King Size 14" Saatva mattress. I am so happy to have found such a GREAT product for such a GREAT price!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Even without the instructions, it is pretty intuitive, but I did have to go back and read them to make sure as the legs were moving around. I failed to tighten some things up, so it was my fault, not the instructions (which specifically said to tighten). Very sturdy on my queen sized bed and put together in 30 minutes with no real trouble. I highly recommend it over regular wooden slats.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Product
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to install but throw away the 6 wood screws that come with installation hardware and use some decent screws. As other reviewers have noted, it is wise to add nuts/washers to the underside of the 3 plastic foot retainers to provide extra support for these plastic retainers.
customer_reviews.author: USAMaca

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges and Poor Workmanship: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product quality. Item works but the workmanship was horrible: the metal edges were sharp and unfiled, plenty of places where you could pinch your fingers. The black metal paint was peeling off. It looked like a cheap product. I pinched my thumb and my girlfriend cut her fingers on the product during construction. Would not buy again or would buy a similar item from a different vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Divye Kapoor

customer_reviews.title: Good for sagging box springs
customer_reviews.text: Our bed frame, although having very sturdy edges, didn't have any internal supports for the box springs. The choice was among getting a new box springs (which would likely suffer the same fate,) one of the full-platform box spring replacements, or this. What wasn't as obvious from the installation manual is you've got to start from the center -- finishing its install first -- and then that will set up where the other two cross-pieces will go.
customer_reviews.author: S MILLER

customer_reviews.title: LOVE - Best purchase - Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the first items that I have written a "LOVE" review on. I didn't know a product like this actually existed. After two failed attempts at reconstructing my bed support, I went on line and looked for a mattress support system. What an amazing transformation it has made to the support of my King size bed. Extremely sturdy, great quality. It has eliminated all the squeaking in the bed and has provided amazing support! Thank you for a great product at what I believe is an extremely affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Study but hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The instruction are ridiculous. I would recommend install the middle bar last as you have to combine it with one of the other crossbars. The bed frame is very sturdy. I bought this because my wood slats would no longer stay screwed into the rails. These metal slats add extra support to my bed
customer_reviews.author: Kaelan

customer_reviews.title: Questionable at first...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a full size metal bed frame. It also arrived by the expected date. The only problem I noticed was the packaging. One end was ripped open but looked as if someone tried to tape it back up before it arrived to my house. I thought it was strange that I didnt see a packet with screws/bolts ect or any instructions. Surprisingly, the packet that included the instructions, along with screws, arrived in the mail the next day. Overall great product that will last throughout the years.
customer_reviews.author: DBrown463

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, isn't hard to assemble but lacking instructions
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I can now use the beautiful but cheap bed frame that had structural issues. Very sturdy and supportive. I would recommend using pallets to support the mattress so the weigh is distributed evenly. The assembly process is easy once you figure out what you need to do. The instructions lay out the main steps but fail to mention important details that could lead to misalignment of the support and lots of frustration. I recommend googling instructions or watching a youtube video rather than relying on the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup and works great
customer_reviews.text: Provides the security and stability for an old bed frame that used wooden slats. Easy to setup, take your time to understand how the pieces go together. The "spine" pieces need to be installed so that the notch in them are connected to the middle cross support. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Long-time Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but not as universal as they make it seem
customer_reviews.text: Quality is good, directions are good, but product isn’t as universal as they make you think. The bed this was going on had brackets built into it for the rails to go on. The rails adjusted fine but the “x” crossbraces did not fit at that point so being used without them.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver12

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a sleigh bed. The wooden slats didn’t seem sturdy enough, so I purchased this. It was fairly easy to install. Unfortunately, this product doesn’t provide enough support. Now there are holes in the mattress if I lay on an area where the metal slat isn’t under. Such a waste of money. We should have kept our wooden slats. This product created problems we didn’t have before. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Franny

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it. Trust me.
customer_reviews.text: Bullet proof. Just get it. I researched and debated which one to get. Definitely this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Walter J. Palen

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous support. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical seeing just 3 support rods but the feedback was good. Makes a huge difference to the support of the bed. We were missing slats & the company (not on amazon) very hard to get hold off. Even I can put this together & I cannot bare doing that kind of thing. This is easy & you'll be hopefully just as happy.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: The Best Bed Frame EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bed support system was so easy to put together less than 20min!! The hardest part was adjusting the leg part for the floor just joking!!!This frame support is very,very study no noise when moving around the bed FIVE Stars for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Brentley T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the expense!!
customer_reviews.text: This did not provide the support I was looking for, my mattress was not supported at all, and I definitely would not recommend. The bars move up and down, and side to side, and are not steady at all. The instructions were hard to follow, and the end results were NOT worth the money I spent on it!! Not to mention, Amazon wouldn't let me return it without a crazy charge, so now I'm stuck with this crappy thing that I wish I had never bought.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I have an old house and it was not made for box springs so I had to get split box springs. And needed something to support them. This went together so easy and the bed is more stable than it has ever been.
customer_reviews.author: Emily MN

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I didn't want to use the slats that came with my new bed. The guys that came to deliver my bed even complimented them. One of the gentlemen mentioned that he even recommends them to many people.
customer_reviews.author: Tai Harris

customer_reviews.title: Bed frame
customer_reviews.text: We have a wood headboard and foot board, but ee did not have wooden rails, but metal so it wasn't exactly the right one. We are unable to use the extra criss cross supports because the spacing is too far apart. Other than that it fulfills it purpose just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia L.

customer_reviews.title: An excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. We didn’t have the issue with the plastic parts breaking like other reviews mentioned. I hate a bed that creaks when you get up and down and roll. This frame reinforced our wood bed and it’s completely silent now. Mattress feels more supportive now too, which is great for sleep and longevity if the mattress!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great support system
customer_reviews.text: Our original bed supports kept falling and we had to keep putting it back up which was such a pain cause you had to lift the mattress and the box springs off the bed to do it. I really wish I had bought this support system sooner. The instructions were not that great but it was pretty easy to put together and it is very study. It's nice to have great support under the bed again.
customer_reviews.author: Tfrosty

product_meta.title: Glideaway X-Support Bed Frame Support System, GS-3 XS Model - 3 Cross Rails and 3 Legs - Strong Center Support Base for Full, Queen and King Mattress, Box Springs, and Bed Foundations
feature_bullets: STRONG SUPPORT FOR BEDS: Patented X-System keeps bed frame legs vertical and in place, preventing them from sliding out of position. All-steel cross rails combined with heavy-duty super clamp and X Support provide the ultimate in support for your bed, foundation, and bedding. Stronger alternative to bed slats. No more sagging mattress!

UNIVERSAL FIT: Suitable for Full / Double, Queen, King / Eastern King, and California King size Beds. Works with Mattresses, Box Springs, and Foundations. Compatible with steel, iron, metal, and wood bed frames (bed frame not included).
EASY TO USE: Clear, uncomplicated instructions are included. Pre-drilled holes allow you to easily secure the cross slats to your bed using the included screws.
ADJUSTABLE HEIGHTS: Easily adjusts for bed heights as low as 6 inches up to 15-1/2"tall. For use with headboards (Not Included), footboards (Not Included) and side rails with lip (Not Included).
FAMILY OWNED IN THE USA: Glideaway is a family-owned company that has been dedicated to providing value-based and innovative sleep products to their customers for over 50 years.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,703 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
